document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Zeugophora (Coleoptera, Megalopodidae, Zeugophorinae) in Japan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Zeugophora (Coleoptera, Megalopodidae, Zeugophorinae) in Japan

bibRefCitation.author: Chujo, M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Chujo, M. (1958) Chrysomelid-beetles of Loo-Cho Archipelago (V). Memories of the Faculty of Liberal Arts and Education, Kagawa University, (2) 64, l.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Zeugophora gracilis unicolor Chûjô, 1958
[ type locality: Okinawa Is. Yurudji];
Takizawa, 2006: 2
[listed].

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . Measurement. Body length: female, PL , 0.71–0.79 mm ; PEL, 2.87–3.20 mm . Width: HW, 0.75–0.78 mm ; PW , 0.83–0.92 mm ; PPW, 0.70–0.77 mm ; EW, 1.15–1.31 mm . Biometric data are given in Table 9 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 9. Biometric data for
Zeugophora gracilis
unicolor
Chûjô, 1958
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration. Body testaceous. Apex of mandible black. Antenna brown except for first and second segments.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 39.
Zeugophora gracilis
unicolor
Chûjô, 1958
. A. Pronotum, dorsal view; B. Thorax, ventral view; C. Antenna; D. Mandible, left part. Scales. A–C. 1 mm; D. 100μm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs furnished with setae; tibial setae becoming longer and denser apically. Hind femora thickened. Tibiae straight; mid and hind tibiae with sharp and fine crenulated carina along external face. Apex of protibia with one spur; apices of meso- and metatibiae with two spurs. Tarsi distinctly shorter than tibiae, and basal three segments gradually widened apically.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 40.
Zeugophora gracilis
unicolor
Chûjô, 1958
. A. Head; B. Pronotum, dorsal view; C. Thorax, ventral view; D. Male posterior margin of 7th sternite; E. Female posterior margin of 7th sternite.

FIGURE 41. Setiferous punctures of
Zeugophora gracilis
unicolor
Chûjô, 1958
. A. Head surface; B. Pronotum; C. Metaventrite; D. Elytron.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks . Chûjô (1958) designated 9 cotypes as syntypes in his original description, therefore, I designated one male specimen (18-tt-274) as the lectotype ( Fig. 43 ), and the other 8 specimens (18-tt-263, 267–273) become paralectotypes .
There have been few records of this species since its original description.

Types .
Lectotype ♂ ( KUM ): "Yurudji, IS. OKINAWA , LOO-CHOO ,
26.V.1958
, COLL . K. IHA.", "Cotype.", " Zeugophora gracilis unicolor CHÛJÔ , Det. M.
CHUJO , 1958
.", "18-tt-274, ex. by T. Takemoto , SEHU , Japan ."
.

;

Takemoto , SEHU , Japan ."; "18-tt-270, ex. by T. Takemoto , SEHU , Japan ."; "18-tt-271, ex. by T. Takemoto , SEHU , Japan ."
.
